com.tapad.tapestry

Class TapestryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tapad.tapestry.TapestryClient

  • public class TapestryClient
extends java.lang.Object
    A client for sending requests to the Tapestry Web API and returning responses. The client should be instantiated once your activity has entered onCreate(). If you use the client across many Activities, you may wish to use the TapestryService wrapper instead.

    The client sends a TapestryRequest as an HTTP request to the Tapestry Web API and parses the JSON response as TapestryResponse. When calling the client from the Android UI thread, it is recommended to send requests asynchronously by passing in a TapestryCallback so as not to block the UI thread.

    An example of sending a request and receiving an asynchronous response: 

     TapestryClient client = new TapestryClient(context);
 TapestryRequest request = new TapestryRequest();
 // TODO build request
 client.send(request, new TapestryCallback() {
     @Override
     public void receive(TapestryResponse response) {
         // TODO handle response
     }
 });
    Note if the callback updates the UI then you should use the TapestryUICallback convenience class which runs the callback on the UI thread. The client throws no exceptions unless Logging#setThrowExceptions(boolean) has been set to true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TapestryClient

        public TapestryClient(Context context)
        Creates client ready to receive requests. Client cannot be instantiated before onCreate is called. Partner id will be read from tapad.PARTNER_ID in the manifest or default if none exists. The url of the API will be read from tapad.API_URL in the manifest or default if none exists.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the app

      • TapestryClient

        public TapestryClient(Context context,
              java.lang.String partnerId)
        Creates client ready to receive requests. Client cannot be instantiated before onCreate is called. The url of the API will be read from tapad.API_URL in the manifest or default if none exists.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the app
        partnerId - The Tapestry partner id that has been assigned to you

      • TapestryClient

        public TapestryClient(Context context,
              java.lang.String partnerId,
              java.lang.String url)
        Creates client ready to receive requests. Client cannot be instantiated before onCreate is called.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the app
        partnerId - The Tapestry partner id that has been assigned to you
        url - The url of the tapestry host

      • TapestryClient

        public TapestryClient(Context context,
              java.lang.String partnerId,
              java.lang.String url,
              HttpStack stack)
        Creates client ready to receive requests. Client cannot be instantiated before onCreate is called.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the app
        partnerId - The Tapestry partner id that has been assigned to you
        url - The url of the tapestry host
        stack - The stack for sending and receiving http requests

                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Sends a request synchronously, blocking until response is received.
        Parameters:
        request - The request
        Returns:
        a response from the server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • optIn

        public void optIn(Context context)
        Opts this device into tracking. Tapestry will collect ids and send requests from this app.

      • optOut

        public void optOut(Context context)
        Opts this device out of all tracking. Tapestry will not be able to send requests from this app. All responses will be a TapestryResponse containing an TapestryError.OPTED_OUT error.

      • addParameters

        public TapestryRequest addParameters(TapestryRequest request)
        Adds parameters which are required (e.g. device identifiers and partner id) to a request.
        Parameters:
        request - A request
        Returns:
        the request with additional parameters
